entity_name: Hyperion Ventures Fund I (Hyperion Investment Management, LLC)
data_room_sources: Hyperion Ventures I LP - Portfolio Summary (10.26.25).xlsx

conspicuous_gaps.description: Henry Bellew listed as Co-General Partner but appears only on one page of 30-page pitch deck (Page 6). No case studies feature Henry's involvement, no founder testimonials mention him, and no clear articulation of his role, responsibilities, or contribution to fund strategy.
conspicuous_gaps.significance: Is this truly a two-GP partnership, or is Henry a junior partner with limited operating role? Material for assessing team capability and capacity.
conspicuous_gaps.risk_level: Moderate concern - impacts team assessment and capacity planning

conspicuous_gaps.description: Portfolio Summary spreadsheet dated 10.26.25 (late October 2025) but contains 2024 data. Case Studies reference speculative 2024 rounds ('Q3-25 Series B,' '2H-25 Series A') that should now be actuals if analyzing in late 2025. Missing ~1 year of portfolio updates between data snapshot (2024) and analysis date (Nov 2025).
conspicuous_gaps.significance: Cannot assess current portfolio performance, recent markups/markdowns, or whether 2024 projections materialized. Material gap for understanding real-time performance.
conspicuous_gaps.risk_level: Material concern - prevents assessment of current performance

conspicuous_gaps.description: Claim: 'Deployed $1.0+ billion across 15+ deals' at Vista (2021-2025). Unclear what 'deployed' means: Did Dillon source, lead, sit on boards, or participate? No clarification of specific role or contribution to cited deals (Databricks, Fivetran, Acronis). Vista is a large firm with multiple deal teams—how much credit should Dillon claim?
conspicuous_gaps.significance: Risk of overstating contribution to institutional track record. Material for assessing actual deal experience vs. affiliation credit.
conspicuous_gaps.risk_level: Moderate concern - affects evaluation of institutional experience

conspicuous_gaps.description: 'Digital assets excluded' + 'non-core investments omitted' per 'subjective view of Mr. Dunteman' with no disclosure of how many investments excluded or their performance. Quantinuum valuation marked at $10.6B secondary transaction (March 2025) vs. $5.3B last institutional round (Feb 2024). Secondary transactions can be illiquid, non-representative, upward biased—material for TVPI calculation.
conspicuous_gaps.significance: Selective performance reporting + aggressive valuation methodology may overstate track record. If Quantinuum marked at $5.3B instead of $10.6B, TVPI would materially decline.
conspicuous_gaps.risk_level: Material concern - directly impacts TVPI accuracy and portfolio representation

conspicuous_gaps.description: Founder letter claims 'since 2019' positioning in deeptech, but no public thought leadership archive included. Fusion blog post mentioned in Deeptech Perspectives but not in dataroom—when was it written relative to fusion investments? Figure AI timing: Invested April 2023, ~5 months after ChatGPT (Nov 2022) sparked AI robotics hype—early or reactive?
conspicuous_gaps.significance: Risk of retroactive narrative construction if theses were written after investments. Material for distinguishing predictive insight from post-hoc rationalization.
conspicuous_gaps.risk_level: Material concern - questions authenticity of 'early positioning' narrative

hero_journey.summary: The dataroom constructs a classic founder origin story

phases.name: Inspiration
phases.description: Science fiction → Harvard engineering → deeptech passion

phases.name: Early lessons
phases.description: Quantinuum win at age 23, followed by 3 underperformers teaching humility

phases.name: Discipline
phases.description: Learning rigor from "most respected enterprise software PE firm," deploying $1B+

phases.name: Opportunity
phases.description: Deeptech inflection points arrive, time to build Hyperion with proven track record

hero_journey.positioning: This narrative positions Dillon as uniquely qualified: technical depth (Harvard Mechanical Engineering), financial rigor (Vista training), early positioning (investing since 2020), and authentic founder relationships (12 glowing testimonials).

details: Quantinuum: $660K check at $244M entry valuation → $10.6B current valuation = 43.4x return (though footnote reveals $10.6B is secondary transaction, last institutional round was $5.3B = 21.7x on entry)
Figure AI: $40K check at $420M entry valuation → $39.5B current valuation = 94x return (April 2023 Series A investment)
Portfolio-level: 6.7x TVPI / 77% IRR outperforming top-decile venture across 2017-2021 vintages
Claims 8.2x net TVPI for early-stage investments only (Pre-seed through Series A)
Founder network: "50+ passive referrals/year" while at Vista, ramping to "300+ per year" with Hyperion
Harvard ecosystem: "Youngest Harvard-led GP" with Prod accelerator access (Cursor $9.9B, Mercor $10B, Devin $10B valuations)
VC partnerships: Collaborators with 14 early-stage deeptech VCs + partnerships with 40+ generalist VCs across tiers
Founder referral flywheel: Portfolio companies refer peers (Quantinuum → aqora; Normal → Primitive Instruments, Outtake)
Harvard B.S. Mechanical Engineering: Senior thesis on micro-robotic bees, quantum computing algorithms, grid storage power systems
Vista Equity Partners: Helped deploy $1.0+ billion across 15+ deals (Databricks $62B, Fivetran $5.6B, Acronis $4.5B valuations)
Deep vertical networks: Quantum (120+ founders contacted, 23 calls), fusion (met 20 startups), cybersecurity ($320M deployed across 3 Vista companies)
Spearheaded AI research and strategy for Vista team from '23-'25

market_timing.summary: Market timing as value creation catalyst
details: "AI catalyzing underappreciated deeptech categories" with 2025 inflection points
Claims "early positioning since 2019" before commercial inflection points across quantum, fusion, robotics
Large TAMs: $170B quantum (2040), $1T fusion, $350B robotics per cited research (McKinsey, Bloomberg, Morgan Stanley)

risk_synthesis.red_flags: Three red flags (stale data, aggressive valuation, timing ambiguities) directly affect track record accuracy and narrative authenticity.
risk_synthesis.yellow_flags: Two yellow flags (Co-GP underrepresentation, Vista role ambiguity) raise questions about team structure and credit attribution but are less immediately material.
mitigating_factors: Transparent failure disclosure (2 underperforming case studies)
Detailed case studies demonstrate honesty and process transparency

validation_tiers.goal: Address stale data, valuation methodology, and role clarity

actions.title: Review Portfolio Summary spreadsheet (10.26.25) first
bullets: Extract all 24 companies with investment dates, entry valuations, current valuations, status
Verify data recency: Is this actually 2024 data or current as of late 2025?
Calculate TVPI sensitivity: What if Quantinuum marked at $5.3B (institutional) vs. $10.6B (secondary)?

actions.title: Verify key valuations via Crunchbase, PitchBook, news archives
bullets: Quantinuum: Footnote reveals $10.6B is secondary transaction vs. $5.3B last institutional round
Figure AI $39.5B Series C valuation (April 2025), Zap Energy ~$1.1B valuation
Check other footnotes for material caveats (SAFE caps, convertible notes)

actions.title: Clarify Vista role and contribution
bullets: Web search: News, PitchBook for Vista's participation in cited deals (Databricks, Fivetran, Acronis)
LinkedIn: Dillon's role, tenure, team at Vista (2021-2025)
Determine: Did he source, lead, board seat, or participate? How much credit is appropriate?

actions.title: Timing verification for "early positioning" claims
bullets: Web search: Dillon's public thought leadership 2019-2023 (blog posts, articles, talks, tweets, Medium, Substack)
Find fusion blog post mentioned in Deeptech Perspectives—when published vs. when invested?
Figure AI: April 2023 investment was 5 months after ChatGPT (Nov 2022)—early or reactive per market consensus?

validation_tiers.goal: Characterize networks and validate institutional affiliations

actions.title: Characterize Dillon's networks by category with relationship depth assessment
bullets: Harvard: LinkedIn connections to Prod founders (Cursor, Mercor, Devin), Prod accelerator relationship
Deeptech: Quantum (Quantinuum, 120+ founders contacted), fusion (20+ startups met), robotics
VCPE: Vista colleagues, Firmament partners, 50+ VC collaborators
Assess depth: Advisory roles, board seats, co-investment patterns

actions.title: Independent validation via web search, LinkedIn, co-investor references
bullets: Web search: Vista Equity Partners press releases, news mentioning Dillon (2021-2025)
LinkedIn: Verify employment at Vista (2021-2025) and Firmament (2019-2021)
Contact co-investors in Dillon's deals (not just portfolio founders) for perspective

validation_tiers.goal: Clarify Henry Bellew's role as Co-GP

actions.title: Understand Co-GP Henry Bellew's contribution
bullets: LinkedIn: Henry's background (The Raine Group, Bedrock advisory, Harvard)
Dataroom review: Where does Henry appear? What responsibilities mentioned?
Is this a true partnership or is Henry a junior/support role?

conclusion.summary: Hyperion Ventures presents a strong performance narrative (6.7x TVPI / 77% IRR) driven by two major outliers (Quantinuum 43.4x, Figure AI 94x), with systematic sourcing advantages ("50+ passive referrals/year" ramping to "300+") and technical credibility from elite institutions (Harvard engineering, Vista $1B+ deployment).
conclusion.critical_gaps_summary: However, five critical gaps materially impact assessment: stale portfolio data (2024 data presented in late 2025), aggressive valuation methodology with material exclusions ($10.6B secondary vs. $5.3B institutional for Quantinuum), timing ambiguities around "early positioning since 2019" claims, Co-GP underrepresentation (Henry Bellew minimal presence), and Vista role ambiguity ($1B+ deployment without role clarity).
conclusion.recommendation: Address critical gaps via Tier 1 validation (Section 3). Central question: Are these gaps explainable (standard VC practices, dataroom timing), or do they indicate material issues with track record representation, team capability, or narrative construction?
